results.title: Plants that live in water
results.brief_description: From a pond to the sea, we investigate the structure of plants suited for life in the water. Careful distinction is made between two major plant groups. Examples of the simplest group, the algae, range from microscopic “pond scum” to giant kelps. Examples of plants with true leaves, stems and roots range from eloda to water hyacinth, water lily and lotus.

results.title: Plants that grow from leaves, stems and roots. - Rev. ed.
results.brief_description: This film contains sophisticated vocabulary with limited explanations. It shows plant growth covering bulbs, corns, tubers, etc. and concentrates on asexual reproduction as required by orchardists and horticulturalist. The contents are comprehensive and the time-lapse photography very good. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Plants make food
results.creator_credit: Gunther V. Fritsch and Churchill Films
results.brief_description: In a simple way this film compares the plant to a factory of which the roots, stems and leaves form parts. The intake of raw materials is discussed and also the dependence on chlorophyll and sunlight. Mention is also made of the way plants store food.

results.title: Plants and animals depend on each other
results.creator_credit: William Coss and Coronet Instructional Media
results.brief_description: Allows children to investigate the question - why is it that plants and animals always seem to live together? As they observe relationships among plants and animals in an aquarium, in ponds, woodlands, grass lands, and in the ocean. Food, shelter, transportation, oxygen, carbon dioxide and reproduction are some of the needs and processes examined.

results.title: Planting and transplanting at the Brooklyn Botanic Garden
results.creator_credit: Sumner J. Glimcher and Center for Mass Communication of Columbia University
results.brief_description: Demonstrates planting and transplanting of flowers, shrubs and trees, covering seeds, bulbs and plants, root and top pruning, potting, watering, mulching and soil preparation.

results.title: Plantation in Peru
results.creator_credit: Clifford J. Kamen and Hollywood Film Enterprises
results.brief_description: Sketches the process of irrigation and sugar growing in an almost rainless desert between the Andes and the Pacific Ocean. Shows levelling land for irrigation, planting of cane, burning off and harvesting. Gives glimpses of bull-fighting and the life of Peruvian villagers.

results.title: Plant tropisms and other movements
results.brief_description: Illustrates the essential movements of several common plants in response to internal and external stimuli. Differentiates between three basic types of movement: tropistic, nastic and nutational. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Plant traps
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and ERPI Classroom Films
results.brief_description: Shows how the pitcher plant lures insects to its trap, where they drown. The sundew, another carnivorous plant, is shown throughout its life cycle. The enfolding of insects by its leaf tentacles is presented by means of time-lapse photography.
